cards.rules_text:
When Tanboku enters, destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Whenever an artifact or enchantment is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, its controller gains 2 life.

When Naruko enters, shuffle the cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards.
Whenever Naruko attacks, scry 1.
When Konoha enters, search your library for a Plains, Island, Swamp, or Mountain card. Put it onto the battlefield tapped, then return a land you control to its owner's hand.

Whenever Kasumi enters or attacks, you may put a creature from your hand onto the battlefield. It's an Illusion in addition to its other types. Return it to your hand at the beginning of the next end step.

Ward—Pay 3 life.
Whenever Megumi attacks, choose up to one creature defending player controls. It gets -1/-1 until end of turn and must block Megumi this turn if able.

Lifelink
When Mikoto enters, if she was cast, reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card with mana value 4, then put it onto the battlefield under your control. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. Then do the same for mana value 3 and mana value 2.

When Miyo and Tsubame enters, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
Whenever Miyo and Tsubame attacks, name a card type, then reveal the top card of your library. If the revealed card has the chosen type, put a +1/+1 counter on each attacking creature.

When you cast this spell, discover X, where X is the number of cards in your graveyard. [i](To discover X, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card with mana value X or less. Cast it without paying its mana cost or put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom in a random order.)[/i]
Whenever one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to a player, you may look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

Menace
Whenever Bon enters or attacks, target player chooses one — That player draws two cards; or that player creates a 2/2 black Youkai creature token; or that player creates two Treasure tokens. At the beginning of the next end step, you choose one — That player discards two cards; or that player sacrifices a creature; or that player sacrifices a land.

Target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
Until your next turn, noncreature spells cost an additional “Pay 1 life” to cast. You lose 1 life.

Emerge from artifact {4}{B} [i](You may cast this spell by sacrificing an artifact and paying the emerge cost reduced by that artifact's mana value.)[/i]
Menace
You may cast this card from your graveyard using its emerge ability.

At the beginning of each player's combat, put a flower counter on another target creature that player controls. It has “this creature gets +1/-1 and can't block.”
Whenever a creature with one or more flower counters on it dies, its controller draws that many cards and loses that much life.

Flying, haste
Lokhens gets +1/+1 as long as you discarded a card this turn, gets +1/+1 as long as you sacrificed a nonland permanent this turn, and gets +1/+1 as long as you lost life this turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“...You mere phantome, neither living nor of flesh. You are nothing to me. Flee... And return nevermore.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 3 life unless you discard a card.

As an additional cost to cast Demon spells, you may pay 2 life any number of times. Those spells cost {1} less to cast for each 2 life you paid.

Whenever Nanahiyakumi enters or attacks, create your choice of a Food token or Clue token.

Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may choose one that hasn't been chosen this turn —
• Inasa deals 3 damage to any target
• Creatures without flying can't block this turn.
• Search your library for a land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

Choose one or both —

Ruine gets +1/+1 for each mana value among cards you own in exile.
Ruine has flying as long as a card you own in exile has flying. The same is true for first strike, double strike, deathtouch, haste, hexproof, indestructible, lifelink, menace, protection, reach, trample, and vigilance.

Flash
When Jinka enters, phase out another target creature you control. Note that creature's name.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you don't control a permanent with the noted name, look at the top card of your library. If it has the noted name, you may reveal it and put it into your hand.

Trample, reach, haste
